source:
As information regarding sync conflicts or completed transaction occur they are logged for
debugging and providing information to clients.
option: Local POS inventory and online inventories are periodically compared  and resolved into a master inventory list. This list is then sent to both the local POS and online inventory so that they can be updated. This sync logs conflicts (See requirement 11) and notifies clients and customers with the appropriate information when the conflicts occur.

source:

source:
As information regarding sync conflicts or completed transaction occur they are logged for
debugging and providing information to clients.
option: A log of all sales for an individual web store are recorded online and saved on the associated client’s computer at next sync. source:
As information regarding sync conflicts or completed transaction occur they are logged for

source:

source: Local POS inventory and online inventories are periodically compared  and resolved into a master inventory list. This list is then sent to both the local POS and online inventory so that they can be updated. This sync logs conflicts (See requirement 11) and notifies clients and customers with the appropriate information when the conflicts occur.

source:

source:
As conflicts occur with sales or inventories either online or offline the system handles each
kind of conflict as well as it is capable of doing.
option:
All conflicts resulting from online to online interactions are handled by the server
immediately. This prevents duplicate stock from being sold or informs the user(s) that a conflict has occurred and that their transaction will not be processed or it will be refunded.

source:
As conflicts occur with sales or inventories either online or offline the system handles each
kind of conflict as well as it is capable of doing.

This sync logs conflicts (See requirement 11) and notifies clients and customers with the appropriate information when the conflicts occur.

source: All conflicts resulting from online to offline inventory deficiencies are handled on sync with the client. Local customers and inventory takes priority over online sales and any conflict resulting from online sales notifies and refunds the online customer
option:
All conflicts resulting from online to online interactions are handled by the server
immediately. This prevents duplicate stock from being sold or informs the user(s) that a conflict has occurred and that their transaction will not be processed or it will be refunded.

source: All conflicts resulting from online to offline inventory deficiencies are handled on sync with the client. Local customers and inventory takes priority over online sales and any conflict resulting from online sales notifies and refunds the online customer

This sync logs conflicts (See requirement 11) and notifies clients and customers with the appropriate information when the conflicts occur.

source:
As inventory is updated, either through a sync with the client or an online sale
occurring, online stock for the items as well as web carts are updated
option:
As items are sold the online inventory is updated. The online stock displayed for each client’s
store is a real time reflection of that client’s store’s online inventory.

source:
As inventory is updated, either through a sync with the client or an online sale
occurring, online stock for the items as well as web carts are updated
option: Clients can create, read, update, and delete from an online interface that immediately updates the online inventory. Local inventory is updated on sync.

source:
As inventory is updated, either through a sync with the client or an online sale
occurring, online stock for the items as well as web carts are updated
option: A customer can inspect items online add them to a web cart and can purchase the item. Before paying for an item or adding an item to a web cart, the system checks the current inventory to make sure the item is not out of stock

source:
As inventory is updated, either through a sync with the client or an online sale
occurring, online stock for the items as well as web carts are updated
option:
A client’s inventory is handled through their local POS (intuit) and then synced with the
system’s online inventory. A client may also edit their inventory either online/offline through the system.

source:
As inventory is updated, either through a sync with the client or an online sale
occurring, online stock for the items as well as web carts are updated
option: Local POS inventory and online inventories are periodically compared  and resolved into a master inventory list. This list is then sent to both the local POS and online inventory so that they can be updated. This sync logs conflicts (See requirement 11) and notifies clients and customers with the appropriate information when the conflicts occur.

source:
All conflicts that occur for an individual web store are logged with any action
taken, such as informing a customer of a deficiency in products, and saved in the database for a limited amount of time under the web store owner’s account.

immediately. This prevents duplicate stock from being sold or informs the user(s) that a conflict has occurred and that their transaction will not be processed or it will be refunded.
